title: Realism: Painting the Unvarnished Truth
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Realism: Painting the Unvarnished Truth.

hook.text: Gustave Courbet painted peasants at actual size â€” the same scale reserved for kings and gods.

buildup.text: Realism rejected both Romantic drama and classical idealization. It showed life as it was.

discovery.text: Courbet's 'The Stone Breakers' depicted backbreaking labor with no moral or heroic framing.

twist.text: Critics called it ugly and vulgar. Courbet said: 'Show me an angel and I'll paint one.'

climax.text: Realism paved the way for every modern movement that valued truth over beauty.

punchline.text: Courbet didn't beautify the world. He dared to just show it.

quiz.question: What was radical about Courbet's Realism?
options: He painted ordinary people at the grand scale of kings
